trans-unit.source: Azure Queue storage is a service for storing large numbers of messages that can be accessed from anywhere in the world via authenticated calls using HTTP or HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Azure Queue storage is a service for storing large numbers of messages that can be accessed from anywhere in the world via authenticated calls using HTTP or HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: A single queue message can be up to 64 KB in size, and a queue can contain millions of messages, up to the total capacity limit of a storage account.
trans-unit.target: A single queue message can be up to 64 KB in size, and a queue can contain millions of messages, up to the total capacity limit of a storage account.

trans-unit.source: A storage account can contain up to 500 TB of blob, queue, and table data.
trans-unit.target: A storage account can contain up to 500 TB of blob, queue, and table data.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title> for details about storage account capacity.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title> for details about storage account capacity.

trans-unit.source: Common uses of Queue storage include:
trans-unit.target: Common uses of Queue storage include:

trans-unit.source: Creating a backlog of work to process asynchronously
trans-unit.target: Creating a backlog of work to process asynchronously

trans-unit.source: Passing messages from an Azure Web role to an Azure worker role
trans-unit.target: Passing messages from an Azure Web role to an Azure worker role

trans-unit.source: The Queue service contains the following components:
trans-unit.target: The Queue service contains the following components:

trans-unit.source: URL format: Queues are addressable using the following URL format: http://.queue.core.windows.net/
trans-unit.target: URL format: Queues are addressable using the following URL format: http://.queue.core.windows.net/

trans-unit.source: The following URL addresses a queue in the diagram:

trans-unit.source: Storage Account: All access to Azure Storage is done through a storage account.
trans-unit.target: Storage Account: All access to Azure Storage is done through a storage account.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title> for details about storage account capacity.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title> for details about storage account capacity.

trans-unit.source: Queue: A queue contains a set of messages.
trans-unit.target: Queue: A queue contains a set of messages.

trans-unit.source: All messages must be in a queue.
trans-unit.target: All messages must be in a queue.

trans-unit.source: Message: A message, in any format, of up to 64KB.
trans-unit.target: Message: A message, in any format, of up to 64KB.
